an5.195:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an5.195:1.2: Now at that time around five hundred Licchavis were visiting the Buddha.
an5.195:1.3: Some of the Licchavis were in blue, of blue color, clad in blue, adorned with blue. And some were similarly colored in yellow, red, or white.
an5.195:1.4: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.
an5.195:2.1: Then the brahmin Piṅgīyānī got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
an5.195:2.2: “I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
an5.195:2.3: “Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.
an5.195:2.4: So the brahmin Piṅgīyānī extolled the Buddha in his presence with a fitting verse.
an5.195:3.2: that blooms in the morning, its fragrance unfaded—
an5.195:3.4: bright as the sun in the sky!”
an5.195:4.1: Then those Licchavis clothed Piṅgiyānī with five hundred upper robes.
an5.195:4.2: And Piṅgiyānī clothed the Buddha with them.
an5.195:5.1: Then the Buddha said to the Licchavis:
an5.195:5.2: “Licchavis, the appearance of five treasures is rare in the world.
an5.195:5.4: A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha.
an5.195:5.5: A person who explains the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.
an5.195:5.6: A person who understands the teaching and training proclaimed by a Realized One.
an5.195:5.7: A person who practices in line with the teaching.
an5.195:5.8: A person who is grateful and thankful.
an5.195:5.9: The appearance of these five treasures is rare in the world.”
